Vivian Wong

PhD student at Stanford University

Hi! I am a PhD student at Stanford University studying Civil Engineering. My interest lies in solving critical urban problems with the help of AI. I also study how computer vision methods can be used to automatically monitor manufacturing processes.

About

Timeline:

Presently | PhD in Civil Engineering - Engineering Informatics Group, Stanford CA
March 2019 | Master of Science in Civil Engineering - Stanford University, Stanford CA
May 2017 | Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering - University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Urbana IL
May 2014 | High School Diploma & International Baccalaureate Diploma - Bayview Secondary School, Richmond Hill ON, Canada

Activities:

Co-Founder & President - Bridges to Prosperity UIUC Chapter (September 2017 - May 2018)
- Helped construct 2 pedestrian bridges in developing communities in Central America
Field Representative - Saha Global, Ghana (Summer 2017)
Society of Women Engineers (2014-2018)
- See how I’m “always connecting, always engineering” on the WE17 Conference website here

If you would like to chat with me about any of my past, present and future work, please send me an email via the little mail icon on the side panel to the left. I would likely want to know more about yours, too.
